channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-13151] Clean up UGI objects in FileSystem cache for transactions
item.description:
One issue with FileSystem.CACHE is that it does not clean itself. The key in that cache includes UGI object. When new UGI objects are created and used with the FileSystem api, new entries get added to the cache.

We need to manually clean up those UGI objects once they are no longer in use.
item.summary: Clean up UGI objects in FileSystem cache for transactions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: To be specific, if we don't clean up the UGI info, we will end up having a lot of FileSystem$Cache$Key entries.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:

ATTACHMENT ID: 12794049 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

Test failure for testTempTable doesn't seem related.

ekoifman Can you take a look?

Shouldn't this be solved in Hadoop? If anything else is using UGI the cache will still leak. What do other submodules do?

1. TestTxnCommands2 - seems to have unused imports added
2. Would it make sense to include CompactionInfo.getFullPartitionName() in the error message for more context? (Worker/Initiator/Cleaner - basically throughout)

Shouldn't this be solved in Hadoop? If anything else is using UGI the cache will still leak. What do other submodules do?

thejas Can you comment on this?

Shouldn't this be solved in Hadoop? If anything else is using UGI the cache will still leak.

AFAIK all of them end up calling closeAllForUgi to avoid the 'cache' leak.

I heard long ago about some new interfaces that would change this. Not sure if that was a concrete proposal. cc sanjay.radia jnp

I talked to Thejas and now I understand this better.

wzheng
+1 on the patch
That is +1 modulo my comments above
Upload patch 4 for test
